title: EyeLineNet: An Ensemble Deep Learning for Eye Health Monitoring with Attention Mechanisms and Grad-CAM Visualization
authors: Arafat Mahmud Towhid, Farhana Yasmin, Samiha Hasan
publish: 2025 Eighth International Conference on Image Information Processing (ICIIP)
abstract: A game changing innovation that delivers swift, precise eye care—protecting vision beforehand. The conventional approaches to diagnosing eye diseases are often inefficient and require expert intervention as well as financially burdensome, thus not optimal for widespread implementation. This study aims to discover a logical solution through the application of advanced intelligence approaches on a publicly available dataset containing 21,577 images categorized into ten classes. Prior to analysis, the dataset was processed and partitioned into training, testing and validation sets. However, the previous outcomes reached an accuracy of 89.64%, employing MobileNet model with Adam optimizer. On the contrary, our applied EfficientNetV2-M (92.50%) and ConvNeXt-Small (92.27%) with an attention mechanism to boost the accuracy through the ensemble of the models, obtained an accuracy of 93.5%, surpassing previous findings in effectiveness. Our method has the potential to be refined for clinical applications, assisting in prompt detection and intervention to prevent vision impairment.

title: AI-Driven Transformation of Human Resource Management: From Performance Evaluation to Fair Recruitment through Image Processing
authors: Kartikay Sharma, Aman Sharma, Tanu Sharma
publish: 2025 Eighth International Conference on Image Information Processing (ICIIP)
abstract: This paper explore the significance of Artificial Intelligence (AI) in Human Resource Management (HRM), discussing its applications, advantages, challenges, and ethical considerations.This study examines the national (India: Digital Personal Information Protection (DPDP) Act, 2023; NITI Aayog AI policy) and international (European Union’s General Data Protection Regulation, GDPR) legal frameworks, which focus on data protection, transparency, and human interventions. This paper provides a important case study on the application of image processing and machine vision in HR recruitment at NovaHire Solutions, demonstrating and how AI-driven visual analytics can enhance justice, diversity, and the collaboration between human and artificial intelligence in decision-making together. The findings disclose the importance of oversight, impairment assessments, and training programs in ensuring the responsible and effective utilisation of AI for management of personnel..

title: Multistep Ahead Prediction of Significant Wave Height using Hybrid Deep Learning Model
authors: Pradeep Singla, Sumit Saroha, Sandeep Sharma, Manoj Duhan
publish: 2025 Eighth International Conference on Image Information Processing (ICIIP)
abstract: Precise prediction of significant wave height (SWH) is vital for maritime safety renewable energy development along with offshore operations. This paper proposes a hybrid forecasting framework that integrates partial swarm optimization (PSO) With Long Short Term Memory (LSTM), Gated Recurrent Unit (GRU) and bidirectional LSTM (BiLSTM) models. PSO is employed for optimization purpose of hyperparameters which directly enhance the performance of the aforesaid models. Using wave data from SmartBay buoy in Galway Bay, the models are evaluated from one to three step ahead forecast. The results demonstrates that proposed PSO-BiLSTM model achieves superior accuracy with one step RMSE of 0.2426 m, MAPE of 10.5% and $R^{2}$ of 0.9788. The finding confirms that the proposed PSO based optimization significantly improves the prediction accuracy and robustness, establishing the proposed framework as a reliable tool score ocean wave forecasting.

title: Voice Health Assistant for Elderly with Multi-Language and Offline Support
authors: R. Chithra, R. Ackshaya, T. Dhinakaran
publish: 2025 10th International Conference on Smart Structures and Systems (ICSSS)
abstract: Older adults often use caregivers and health aides to help them with their health. However, this population often struggles with the care system’s dependence on a network connection, complicated interfaces, and minimal ability for multilingual replies. This project describes a Voice-based Health Assistant with multi-lingual replies that uses engagement in the home with voice interaction, and works as an offline system. The Voice-based Health Assistant contains AI-enabled speech processing in the preferred engagement language as well as wearable health monitoring options to support older adults in health-related tasks that promote independence. The Voicebased Health Assistant contains features for real-time vital signs monitoring, medication prompts, emergency alerts, and cognitive engagement with no dependency on network access. The proposed Voice-based Health Assistant contains accessibility, promotes user independence, and provides an opportunity for social engagement, while promoting overall well-being for older adults.

title: Archimedean t-norm and t-conorm Based Approach to Solve q-rung Orthopair Fuzzy Matrix Games and its Application to Electric Vehicle Market Share Problem
authors: Sandeep Kumar, Aashish
publish: 2025 7th International Conference on Information Systems and Computer Networks (ISCON)
abstract: Fuzzy matrix game theory combines matrix games and fuzzy set theory to analyze the solutions of matrix game with uncertain data. The research paper is devoted to analyze the optimal results for matrix game with q-rung orthopair fuzzy set (q-ROFS) payoffs (q-ROF matrix game) by using Archimedean t-norm and t-conorm (ANC) based averaging operator. In the present work, q-rung orthopair fuzzy weighted averaging operator based on ANC (q-ROFWAAANC) is utilized to aggregate the q-ROFSs for calculating the payoffs of the players. Next, multiple mathematical programming models are constructed to solve the present matrix game problems using ANC, leading to the formulation of a pair of primal-dual linear programming models. Some theorems, already valid for existing matrix games, are also proved for the considered matrix game with ANC. The constructed approach finally is backed by evidence from a numerical example.

title: Understanding Aesthetic Judgments of Modern Sculptures: An Eye-Tracking and Machine Learning Study
authors: Zoryana Andrusyak, Selina Christin Wriessnegger
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Metrology for eXtended Reality, Artificial Intelligence and Neural Engineering (MetroXRAINE)
abstract: Most research on art perception has focused on two-dimensional art, leaving three-dimensional media underexplored. In this study we investigated how non-expert viewers evaluate modern sculptures. In a custom-built virtual reality (VR) art gallery, we asked 28 healthy non-art experts to view 3D scans of 10 figurative modern sculptures and to provide their subjective responses (e.g., emotional impact, likability). Simultaneously, eye-tracking and pupil dilation data were recorded. Using Gradient Boosting Decision Trees with SHAP analysis, we found that only three aesthetic judgments were consistently predictable from sculptural attributes: Beauty, Valence, and Technical Skill. Visual Harmony and Texture were the strongest predictors. Participants preferred smooth, more harmonious sculptures. Aesthetic evaluations became more systematic after exposure to sculptural attributes, with Valence predictions improving from 68% to 88 % explained variance. Eye-tracking analyses showed that aesthetic appreciation involves efficient, focused processing rather than extensive exploration. Participants who rated sculptures as beautiful showed 24% fewer fixations, 26% fewer saccades, longer fixation durations, and significantly lower gaze depth variability, indicating more stable visual attention. These patterns align with processing fluency theory. This approach provides new insights into the cognitive and visual perceptual mechanisms involved in three-dimensional aesthetic experience.

title: Growth and Promotion of Scientific Education Resources Based on Big Data and Intelligent Algorithms
authors: Jinjie Zhang
publish: 2025 IEEE 3rd International Conference on Control, Electronics and Computer Technology (ICCECT)
abstract: With the rapid growth of information technology, big data (BD) and intelligent algorithms have been widely infiltrated into various fields, including education. As the core link in cultivating students' innovative thinking and practical ability, scientific education urgently needs to be innovated through modern technology. Therefore, this paper aims to improve the quality and efficiency of science education by developing and promoting scientific education resources based on BD and intelligent algorithms. This paper first outlines the background and significance, and then reviews the progress of related research and its shortcomings. On this basis, the research methods are elaborated in detail, covering the construction of the technical framework for resource research and growth, the application practice of intelligent algorithms, and the formulation of promotion strategies. Through experimental investigation, this paper analyzes the effect of resource utilization. The results show that scientific education resources based on BD and intelligent algorithms can not only enhance the promotion scope of education resources but also effectively promote the balanced distribution of education resources.

title: TFAN: Combined Time-frequency Contextual Information Modeling for Long-term Series Forecasting
authors: Zhihong Ni, Shenglin He, Zhenkun Wen, Yuanfang Zhu, Shuyan Jin, Shuang Wang
publish: 2025 IEEE 3rd International Conference on Control, Electronics and Computer Technology (ICCECT)
abstract: Multivariate time series forecasting is ubiquitous in various fields such as financial analysis, medical analysis and weather forecasting. In recent times, approaches grounded in deep learning have demonstrated significant promise for tackling time series prediction tasks. However, recent research approaches focus on capturing temporal patterns from a single domain (time or frequency) and do not combine the strengths of both to deal with time series. Inspired by this, we propose a novel forecasting approach for time series data, termed the Time-Frequency Aware Network (TFAN). Specifically, in order to mine deeper temporal dependencies, TFAN captures both global and local information through a frequency-domain MLP module (GFM) and a time-domain convolution module (LTC). The GFM explores a new method of combining the frequency domain with the MLP for time-series prediction, utilizing the properties of the frequency domain to capture key global features. The LTC employs a segmentation mechanism to convolve the different time segments, enabling the model to focus on localized features in different regions. Comprehensive experiments conducted on seven real-world datasets reveal that TFAN consistently surpasses existing state-of-the-art models in both accuracy and efficiency.

title: RIS-Assisted Integrated Sensing and Hybrid Symbiotic Radio Systems
authors: Bin Lyu, Haofan Du, Zongyuan Deng, Yan Liu, Changsheng You, Arumugam Nallanathan
publish: IEEE Communications Letters
abstract: This letter proposes a reconfigurable intelligent surface (RIS) assisted integrated sensing and hybrid symbiotic radio (ISAHSR) system, where the RIS is utilized to not only assist target sensing within the directions of interest, but also support hybrid symbiotic radio (HSR) communications with both parasitic SR (PSR) and commensal SR (CSR) in the absence of direct links. To enable HSR communications, we first introduce a hybrid modulation scheme combining RIS partitioning (RP) and hybrid phase shift (HPS), referred to as the RP–HPS scheme. For this scheme, we maximize the primary transmission performance under practical constraints on target sensing and hybrid secondary transmissions. A two-layer optimization framework is developed to obtain a high-quality solution. Then, we propose the Pure-HPS scheme, where both PSR and CSR setups are achieved solely through phase shift adjustments, eliminating the need for the RP operation. To optimize this scheme, we design a single-layer optimization algorithm with low complexity. Numerical results demonstrate that the Pure-HPS scheme achieves better performance with significantly reduced computational complexity compared to the RP–HPS scheme.

title: Soil Analysis and Crop Recommendation
authors: Diana George, Ganeshan P, Komuravelly Sudheer Kumar, Rizwan Arif, D K Upadhyay, Vinod Sharma
publish: 2025 7th International Conference on Information Systems and Computer Networks (ISCON)
abstract: Soil analysis plays a crucial role in sustainable agriculture by helping farmers maximize crop yield while minimizing ecological damage. It assesses the physical, chemical, and biological traits of soil such as pH, texture, organic matter, nutrient content, and microbial activity to determine soil health. These findings support informed decisions on fertilizer use, irrigation, and crop selection. By aligning crops with site-specific soil conditions, farmers can reduce input costs, enhance productivity, and preserve soil fertility. This precision-based approach promotes efficient resource utilization and minimizes pollution caused by overuse of chemicals. Through the integration of technology and data-driven analysis, soil testing strengthens modern farming systems. Ultimately, it contributes to sustainable food production and long-term environmental conservation by ensuring that agricultural practices maintain ecological balance while improving both crop quality and yield potential.

title: Genetic Algorithm-Optimized Fuzzy Cognitive Maps to Predict Fetal Growth Restriction
authors: María Paula García, Jesus David Díaz, Rodrigo García, William Hoyos
publish: 2025 IEEE Colombian Caribbean Conference (C3)
abstract: Fetal growth restriction (FGR) is a complication of pregnancy in which a fetus does not reach its full growth potential during pregnancy. This condition is a major cause of perinatal morbidity and mortality. One way to address this type of medical problem is to use approaches based on computational intelligence models to detect the disease using variables of different nature. In this work, we develop a methodology (GA-FCM) that integrates genetic algorithms (GA) with fuzzy cognitive maps (FCM) in order to find the best model to predict FGR. Our proposal was evaluated using two datasets containing maternal and fetal variables, signs, symptoms, biochemical markers, and tests related to the Doppler study. The results showed that the models created with GA-FCM have excellent predictive performance. The development of this type of models could contribute to the early detection of this condition so that medical professionals can make the best decisions to ensure the health of the mother and fetus.

title: Research on Reinforcement Learning Algorithm for Sports Club Participation Prediction and Optimization
authors: Zhu Chunli
publish: 2025 IEEE 3rd International Conference on Control, Electronics and Computer Technology (ICCECT)
abstract: This paper proposes a sports club participation prediction and optimization model based on reinforcement learning algorithm, aiming to solve the problems of low prediction accuracy and insufficient optimization efficiency of traditional methods. The system architecture includes data collection and processing, participation prediction and optimization decision modules. The paper can improve the convergence rate and forecast performance through the design of Mult objective reward function and the optimization of training strategy using DQN as the kernel algorithm. The model is fully validated based on the data set of university sports clubs. It is found that the forecast precision of the model is 94.2%, which is superior to the linear regression (87.5<sup xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">%</sup>) and the stochastic forest (91.3%). The optimized resource utilization rate is increased by 18.5%, and the user participation rate is increased by an average of 22.4%. Simulation tests further verify the adaptability and stability of the model in club activities of different sizes. This study provides an effective intelligent solution for the scientific planning and resource optimization of sports club activities. In the future, the research direction of multimodal data fusion and real-time online optimization will be further explored.

title: A Novel Video Caption Method Based on Improved Transformer Model
authors: Shuo Liu, Ming Liu, Liang Shi, Yanfei Chen, Zhongke Zhu, Yuanwang Jin
publish: 2025 IEEE 3rd International Conference on Control, Electronics and Computer Technology (ICCECT)
abstract: In the past few years, video caption has emerged as a key research focus in the realm of artificial intelligent Internet of Things. This paper put forward a new video caption approach that is founded on improved transformer model. As demonstrated by the experimental results, the proposed approach generates video semantic descriptions which are more comprehensive as well as accurate. And it outperforms in multiple performance metrics than traditional transformer method in respect of the MSR-VTT dataset.

title: Generation of Compound Dispatching Rules for FFSP-BPM Based on Improved GEP
authors: Zhaoyang Bai, Huisong Jiang
publish: 2025 IEEE 3rd International Conference on Control, Electronics and Computer Technology (ICCECT)
abstract: This paper investigates the Flexible Flow-shop Scheduling Problem (FFSSP) in an environment characterized by dynamic job arrivals and uncertain processing times. Specifically, the study addresses the issue of scheduling in batch process machines that are parallel and handle incompatible job families. The objective of this research is to minimize both the maximum completion time and the average earliness/tardiness of the jobs. Drawing on the idea of problem decomposition in the literature, constructing compound dispatching rules for solving the original problem, an automatic generation method of combined scheduling rules based on gene expression programming (GEP) is proposed. Taking into account the characteristics of the multi-objective optimization problem, the NSGA-II non-dominated sorting method with the elite strategy is introduced. At the same time, improvement strategies including Repetitive individual elimination, variable neighborhood search and adaptive genetic operator are proposed for the algorithm's shortcomings that the algorithm is prone to repeat individuals and fall into local optimum. Finally, the effectiveness of the proposed improved GEP algorithm is verified by numerical examples. The results show that the improved GEP algorithm is superior to the traditional GEP algorithm and the GEP algorithm with terminal set elements as workshop parameters in terms of the convergence, distribution, and coverage of non-inferior solutions and significantly superior to the classic dispatching rules.

title: Toward Context-Aware, Immersive Testing for Innovative Formative Assessment
authors: Federica Morleo, Pasquale Anselmi, Alessandra Vitanza
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Metrology for eXtended Reality, Artificial Intelligence and Neural Engineering (MetroXRAINE)
abstract: This work presents the construction, implementation, and validation of a novel immersive assessment tool for the formative assessment of soft skills. Grounded in Situated Action Theory and Competence-based Knowledge Space Theory, the test immerses participants in authentic interactions, by leveraging on the use of conversational agents embedded in a narrative framework. Teachers are required to engage in problem-solving, work with virtual colleagues, simulating typical professional interactions. The result of the assessment is the unique collection of collaborative and teamwork skills mastered by each teacher. The test is composed of 20 items, developed in multiple-choice and short answer formats, and it was compiled by 161 Italian teachers. Test validation combined both qualitative and quantitative approaches, confirming that the items actually assess the skills they were assumed to evaluate. Findings suggest that the test allows for uncovering the skills a teacher masters with a fairly high level of confidence. Additionally, they highlight the potential of the test in fostering self-reflection, professional dialogue, and continuous skill growth. The test offers a promising avenue to empower teachers with critical social skills, while promoting a culture of collaboration in education.

title: Hybrid Ensemble Model for Advanced Climate Prediction
authors: Adithya Narayanan, P Venkata Narayana, Rama Parvathy L
publish: 2025 7th International Conference on Information Systems and Computer Networks (ISCON)
abstract: Machine learning (ML) has significantly improved the capabilities of weather forecasting by delivering faster and more accurate predictions compared to traditional Numerical Weather Prediction (NWP) models. Advanced models such as GraphCast, Pangu-Weather, and LSTM architectures have contributed to higher forecast accuracy; however, key challenges remain-particularly in uncertainty estimation, physical consistency, and the prediction of extreme weather events. This study presents a comparative analysis of ML-based weather prediction (MLWP) approaches and conventional forecasting techniques, with a focus on hybrid models that integrate ML with NWP frameworks to enhance overall performance. The findings highlight the strengths and limitations of current models and emphasize the importance of future work in areas such as Explainable AI (XAI), real-time system deployment, and the development of climate-aware models. These directions aim to improve model interpretability, scalability, and robustness under diverse meteorological conditions.

title: A Hybrid Framework for Predicting Stock Market Volatility Using Financial Models and Machine Learning
authors: Aparna Rajesh Atmakuri, Girija Nandini, Pallavi M, Alaka Samantaray, Mohanababu Chappa, Sunita Padhi
publish: 2025 7th International Conference on Information Systems and Computer Networks (ISCON)
abstract: Precisely predicting how volatile the stock market will be is still one of the hardest things to do in finance, but it's important for building smart investment strategies and good risk management. This paper proposes a hybrid predictive model, which takes the strong advantages and performance of the Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) networks and Generalized AutoRegressive Conditional Heteroskedasticity (GARCH) models into consideration, aiming to enhance the volatility prediction. The procedure takes two steps: first, LSTM networks drill down historical stock data to find complicated patterns and produce residuals. The GARCH models then come in to forecast the conditional volatility from these residuals. This hybrid approach can improve the power of LSTM in non-linear patterns and time-series dependencies and, meanwhile, can take advantage of the successfulness of GARCH for modeling volatility clustering. The research, which uses historical data from India's BSE and NSE exchanges, employs careful pre-processing steps such as normalization, feature engineering, and the computation of volatility using the Rogers-Satchell method in order to make the data as clean and relevant as possible. A comprehensive assessment based on MAE, RMSE, R<sup xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">2</sup> demonstrates the effectiveness of this hybrid model over single LSTM and single GARCH models.

title: DVLTA-VQA: Decoupled Vision-Language Modeling with Text-Guided Adaptation for Blind Video Quality Assessment
authors: Li Yu, Situo Wang, Wei Zhou, Moncef Gabbouj
publish: IEEE Transactions on Circuits and Systems for Video Technology
abstract: Inspired by the dual-stream (dorsal and ventral streams) theory of the human visual system (HVS), recent Video Quality Assessment (VQA) methods have integrated Contrastive Language-Image Pretraining (CLIP) to enhance semantic understanding. However, as CLIP is originally designed for images, it lacks the ability to adequately capture the temporal dynamics and motion perception (dorsal stream) inherent in videos. To address this limitation, we propose DVLTA-VQA (Decoupled Vision-Language Modeling with Text-Guided Adaptation), which decouples CLIP’s visual and textual components to better align with the NR-VQA pipeline. Specifically, we introduce a Video-Based Temporal CLIP module and a Temporal Context Module to explicitly model motion dynamics, effectively enhancing the dorsal stream representation. Complementing this, a Basic Visual Feature Extraction Module is employed to strengthen spatial detail analysis in the ventral stream. Furthermore, we propose a text-guided adaptive fusion strategy that leverages textual semantics to dynamically weight visual features, facilitating effective spatiotemporal integration. Extensive experiments on multiple public datasets demonstrate that the proposed method achieves state-of-the-art performance, significantly improving prediction accuracy and generalization capability.

title: Content Retrieval Based Personalized Online Teaching Video Resource Recommendation Method for Universities
authors: Yanhong Zhang, Yiping Chen, Yugang Zhao
publish: 2025 IEEE 3rd International Conference on Control, Electronics and Computer Technology (ICCECT)
abstract: Personalized online teaching video resource recommendation in universities can improve the targeted and object-oriented utilization of teaching resources. A content retrieval based method for personalized online teaching video resource recommendation in universities is proposed. We use user association denoising and interaction enhancement methods to construct a tree structure model for the distribution of online teaching video resources. Based on the correlation between individual users, we establish a user feature distribution map and learn from each other in different views to achieve personalized content retrieval of online teaching resources in universities. Based on the content retrieval results, we implement clustering control of teaching video resources, mine the correlation feature quantities between user groups, and implement deep learning retrieval of content based on feature mining and clustering results. This alleviates the sparsity of data interaction between users and short videos, and achieves resource adaptation recommendation. The simulation results show that using this method for personalized online teaching video resource recommendation in universities effectively solves the problem of interaction sparsity. The clustering of content retrieval output is good, and it pays good attention to users' short-term and postnatal interests and preferences, improving the accuracy of recommendations.

title: Explainable Deep Learning Models for Food Fraud Detection and its Authenticity Analysis
authors: Shourya Thakur, Paras Jain, Shivani Agarwal, Jaishree Meena, Vishan Kumar Gupta, Law Kumar Singh
publish: 2025 7th International Conference on Information Systems and Computer Networks (ISCON)
abstract: Food fraud represents a worldwide escalating threat because it affects public health management alongside consumer safety as well as economic losses. Artificial Intelligence (AI) functions as a powerful investigative tool because traditional food authentication methods fail to discover modern complex food scams. Deep Learning (DL) models prove effective for boosting accuracy together with the efficiency of food fraud detection systems. The research investigates how Explainable Artificial Intelligence (XAI) works with DL models used to analyze food authenticity. DL uses Convolutional neural networks and Recurrent neural networks and generative models as components to perform complete food composition analysis while identifying adulterants and detecting irregularities in both spectral and imaging data series. XAI plays a critical part in making these models easy to understand because it uses Shapley Additive Explanations and Local Interpretable Model-Agnostic Explanations tools to reveal both decision mechanisms and the importance of features. The paper explores the cooperative effect of AI with cutting-edge spectroscopy systems like Near-Infrared, Hyperspectral Imaging, and Raman Spectroscopy when these systems deliver precise compositions of food materials. The field still encounters multiple difficulties including complex computability and live computation and approval regulations together with moral dilemmas.

title: Leveraging AI for Adaptive Narratology in Children's Literature: Enhancing Reader Engagement through Interactive Storytelling
authors: B. Rajasree, Sashka Jovanovska, Vigneshwaran Thangaraju, Reddy Pogu Rajasekar, Sridhar Maisa, R Latha Devi
publish: 2025 7th International Conference on Information Systems and Computer Networks (ISCON)
abstract: A vital component of children's development is literature. Children's literature is an effective means of promoting kids' societal, emotional, and mental growth. It helps kids to recognize legal and moral quandaries by seeing the lifestyles, encounters, and moral difficulties of others. Outside the traditional position of passive individuals, interaction elements in visual storytelling encourage people to thoroughly engage with the narrative. Engagement and emotions are two important factors that greatly impact a reader's perspective throughout a reading job. One statistical technique that aids in determining and evaluating an individual's emotions through written material is sentiment evaluation. Various instruments and approaches were used to analyze text data employing artificial intelligence methods to identify mixed emotions. Employing the Random Forest (RF) method, a 5-fold cross-validation method was used to distinguish between optimistic and sad emotions. In the end, the grid-search strategy was used to adjust the hyperparameters, and the outcomes were contrasted with those of five standard methods: AdaBoost, XGBoost, Support Vector Machine (SVM), LSTM, and Naïve Bayes (NB). According to the research results, the suggested framework outperformed all five cutting-edge techniques with corresponding margins of <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">${4. 6 4 \%}, {1 0. 8 0 \%}, {1 9. 4 5 \%}, {2 1. 1 \%}$</tex>, and 56.6 %, achieving an accuracy percentage of 99.64% on the 4000 stories database. It's noteworthy to note that the suggested approach also produced better outcomes in terms of additional traditional efficiency criteria, including temporal complication, recall, precision, and specificity. All things considered, the suggested framework has enormous possibilities for use in academic settings, child psychology studies, and the monitoring of kid-friendly material, typically aiding in the comprehension of kids' emotions and activities in the electronic sphere.

title: Noninvasive Ultrasonic Level Measurement in High-Pressure Alkaline Electrolyzers
authors: Jens Rau, David Zöller, Lukas Probsthain, Rakesh Mishra, Enno Wagner
publish: 2025 15th France-Japan &amp; 13th Europe-Asia Congress on Mechatronics (MECATRONICS) / 23rd International Conference on Research and Education in Mechatronics (REM)
abstract: The cost-effective production of green hydrogen by water electrolysis is a key issue for the green energy transition. Although current commercial electrolyzers are mainly based on Polymer Electrolyte Membranes (PEM), Anion Exchange Membranes (AEMs) as an ongoing research topic offer the possibility of reducing the initial cost of the system by using nonprecious materials. Subsequently, high-pressure AEM electrolysis decreases the need for mechanical compression. This offers further reduction of initial and operational costs. Subsequently, high-pressure AEM electrolysis offers further reduced initial and operational costs by decreasing the need for mechanical compression. Here, hydrogen is produced at up to $\mathbf{1 0 ~ M P a}$ while the oxygen electrode with the aqueous electrolyte remains at ambient pressure. However, the removal of water vapor and small droplets from the produced hydrogen gas at this high gas pressure is challenging because sensors for level control introduce complexity in regard to tightness and integrity of the system. Therefore, a noninvasive measurement technique to capture the electrolyte level in a liquid separator has been investigated, that can be implemented downstream of a high-pressure electrolyzer. Using an ultrasonic transmitter on the outside of a stainless steel pressure cylinder and a receiver on the opposite side allows level detection. This assembly does not influence the integrity of the pressure cylinder up to $\mathbf{1 0 ~ M P a}$ and enables low-cost level detection by implementation of excitation and analysis on a microcontroller.

title: Deep Learning Ensemble for Neuro-Oncological Diagnostics: Fusion of VGG-16 and Convolutional Neural Network Architectures
authors: Swapnil Yadav, Prateek Singhal, Madan Singh
publish: 2025 Eighth International Conference on Image Information Processing (ICIIP)
abstract: Brain tumors are potentially fatal, prompt and accurate diagnosis is essential to appropriate treatment and management. MRI is a key method for locating tumors in the brain. This study introduces a HYBRID deep learning for binary classification of brain tumors, combining a pre trained VGG16 model with tailored CNN and Neural Networks. The fusion of these models is done via feature concatenation followed by a common classifier. This fusion helps in capturing both high-level abstract and task-specific features critical for classification. To help minimize overfitting and improve generalization, the models are subjected to rigorous data augmentation including rotation, zooming, and horizontal flipping, normalization, and resizing of images to ${1 5 0} {\times} {1 5 0}$ pixels. All models are trained and validated using the same data splits. Performance is determined by accuracy, training and validation loss, confusion matrices, and visualization with Matplotlib plots and Plotly which provide a vivid insight into the models. Experiments are conducted to determine the different model performances and the hybrid model attained an accuracy of 98.14%, which was higher than the standalone VGG16 (93%), CNN (91%), and NN (88%) models.

title: ForenSync: Real-Time IoT Platform for Forensic Evidence Tracking and Audit Logging
authors: S Surenderkumar, S Sanjay, K Saran, V Shanjith, C Shrivarshan
publish: 2025 10th International Conference on Smart Structures and Systems (ICSSS)
abstract: In criminal investigations, preserving justice and integrity are all about proper evidence handling and chain-of-custody protocols. Most paper log sheets fall short in real-world conditions since items go missing, entries may be inconsistent, and they are easily tampered with by unauthorized parties. The proposed system overcomes these shortcomings by replacing manual recording of items with a secure, web-based system. Evidence will be tagged using RFID systems to update locations in real-time, and every action taken on the custody will be recorded on a blockchain ledger to ensure that records are immutable. Role-based access ensures each user interacts with nothing but the relevant operations, and any critical step involves the use of biometric authentication to verify identity. Independently, these components create a clear and continuous transparent chain of custody, improve records’ accuracy and security regarding forensic materials, and increase confidence in judicial proceedings.

title: Bridging Big Data Machine Learning and Human Insight with Visual Interaction
authors: Aby Abraham
publish: 2025 Eighth International Conference on Image Information Processing (ICIIP)
abstract: In this paper we tackle the challenging problem of model interpretability and parameter optimization for machine learning models with large-scale high-dimensional input. Towards this goal, we present a new interactive framework: Transparent Boosting Tree (TBT) which has been designed to create a harmonious back and forth between machine intelligence and human perception. TBT consists of five interlinked visualization perspectives: feature view, forest view, tree view, path purity view and history view, which visually reveal the complex structure and prediction dynamics of gradient boosted trees. The system allows for direct manipulation of model structure via actions including feature selection, node-pruning, tree pruning and path expansion that allow domain expertise to be incorporated into the learning process. We show that TBT works well on the Mushroom classification dataset and a clinical diabetes prediction dataset by exposing structural redundancies (so the model size can be simplified) with no penalty to predictive performance. Our work connects automated machine learning with human guidance, enabling interpretable and user-guided development of predictive models.

title: Development and Implementation of Inverse Kinematics for a KUKA KR6 R900 in MATLAB
authors: Nick Tiz, Jan Falkenhain, Rolf Biesenbach
publish: 2025 15th France-Japan &amp; 13th Europe-Asia Congress on Mechatronics (MECATRONICS) / 23rd International Conference on Research and Education in Mechatronics (REM)
abstract: A fundamental type of movement for industrial robots is the point-to-point (PTP) movement. Various manufacturers provide this type of movement with the purchase of a robot controller. However, the calculation cannot be easily comprehended. This paper deals with the development of Inverse Kinematics for a KUKA KR6 R900 Agilus and the KUKA KRC4 compact robot controller using MATLAB. Then a PTP movement will be implemented with the developed Inverse Kinematics. The KUKA RobotSensorInterface and the MATLAB Toolbox RoBO2 L are used to control the robot. The calculation and the resulting movement are presented here in a comprehensible manner. First, the ambiguities of the kinematics of the aforementioned industrial robot were investigated. Taking these into account, inverse kinematics were developed over the entire workspace of the robot. With this inverse kinematics, all possible joint angle combinations are output for a desired position and orientation (pose) of the tool center point (TCP) in order to achieve this pose. Then, the solution requiring the shortest travel time is found. The axis with the longest path time is then determined in order to adapt the speed of the remaining axes to it. This results in a synchronous PTP movement. It turns out that in most of the robot’s workspace there are up to 24 possible joint angle combinations for a given pose, due to of the multiturn of axes 4 and 6. This means that a robot controller must use suitable criteria to select one of these solutions if more than one solution is available. Here, the solution that moves to the target position in the shortest time was selected.

title: Enhanced Video Summarization Using Superframe-Based Segmentation with Deep Learning and Multilingual Support
authors: R. Sarala, N.R.K Akkash Dheep, Mohamed Farhan Khan, A.R Dhineshkumar
publish: 2025 Eighth International Conference on Image Information Processing (ICIIP)
abstract: We propose a superframe-driven video summarization framework combining ResNet-50 CNN features, Deep Embedded Clustering (DEC), and Bi-LSTM with self-attention mechanisms for keyframe selection, integrated with a multilingual ASR–summarization–translation pipeline. Our method is evaluated on TVSum (50 videos), SumMe (25 videos), OVP (150 videos), and a custom educational dataset (75 lecture videos). The framework achieves F-scores of 0.687 on TVSum and 0.561 on SumMe, representing 8.4% and 6.7% improvements over state-of-the-art methods. Precision of 0.72 and recall of 0.65 demonstrate balanced performance, while maintaining 15:1 compression ratio and temporal coherence of 0.78. The multilingual module integrates Whisper ASR (4.2% WER), BART summarization (ROUGE-L 0.441), and mBART-50 translation, achieving 94.3% average BLEU score across five Indian languages (Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, Bengali, Marathi). Processing efficiency of 45 seconds for 10-minute videos on RTX 3090 enables practical deployment.

title: AI-Driven Comment Classification: Leveraging Deep Learning for Multi-class Sentiment of Social Media Comments
authors: Sankhamit Datta, Bikash Majhi, Hydar Ali, Diwakar Tripathi
publish: 2025 Eighth International Conference on Image Information Processing (ICIIP)
abstract: With the exponential growth of user-generated content on platforms like YouTube, analyzing and classifying on-line comments has become increasingly important for understanding the public sentiment, user engagement, and digital discourse. This study presents an AI-driven comment classification framework leveraging deep learning techniques for effective content moderation. The proposed framework is designed to handle the challenges of noisy social media data, Transformer-based models to capture semantic, contextual, and syntactic features of textual data and classification. The framework begins with rigorous preprocessing and feature extraction using both traditional approaches, such as Term Frequency–Inverse Document Frequency (TF-IDF), and advanced contextual embeddings. These features are then leveraged by a range of models, including classical machine learning algorithms as well as deep learning approaches such as TF-IDF embeddings, Universal Sentence Encoder, BERT, and DistilBERT. Further, the results of the aforementioned approaches are compared in terms of various classification performance measures.

title: Self-Attentive Deep Fusion Framework with Transformer-Based Semantics for Emergency Head CT Reporting
authors: Selene Tomassini, Abdallah Zeggada, Carlo Cosimo Quattrocchi, Farid Melgani, Paolo Giorgini
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Metrology for eXtended Reality, Artificial Intelligence and Neural Engineering (MetroXRAINE)
abstract: Head Computed Tomography (CT) scans are com-monly used in emergency departments to identify neurologi-cal conditions. However, manual radiology reporting is time-consuming and subject to cognitive biases, especially under time constraints. This work presents a self-attentive deep fusion frame-work for automatic radiology reporting tailored to emergency head CT imaging. Building on our previously developed system, the proposed model incorporates clinically validated preprocessing for head CTs, a multimodal neural network refined through fine-grained regularization, and intra-sequence self-attention to enhance context modeling. Eight uniformly resampled slices per scan are used as input, and each report section is generated as an independent caption and semantically ranked using a Transformer-based evaluator based on perplexity. The best pre-dictions are concatenated to form ordered reports. The model was trained and evaluated on a dataset of real-world emergency head CTs using ROUGE-L and METEOR as quantitative met-rics. The proposed system achieved improvements of +6% in ROUGE-L and +3% in METEOR compared to the reference architecture, and +4% and +2% compared to the same model without self-attention. These results confirm the contribution of self-attention for improving contextual coherence and report quality. The framework remains lightweight and scalable, making it suitable for time-sensitive environments. Future work will explore condition-specific modeling and vision-language model integration.

title: Design of a Vision-Guided Hierarchical Control System for Robotic Rebar-Tying Tasks
authors: Jinzhu Shen, Hao Duan, Tengfeng Ai, Haili Jiang, Shuai Guo
publish: 2025 International Conference on Cyber-Physical Social Intelligence (CPSI)
abstract: This paper presents a vision-guided hierarchical control system for robotic rebar-tying tasks in construction environments. The system follows a three-layer distributed architecture consisting of an upper-level interface, a C++-based intermediary controller, and a PLC-controlled robotic unit. The intermediary layer coordinates command parsing, visual perception, motion control, and status feedback, using TCP and ADS protocols for decoupled communication. A YOLOv5-based detection module processes RGB-D images to localize rebar intersections, and coordinate transformation maps detections into robot space. Two task scheduling algorithms are implemented: a basic sequential strategy and an optimized parallel-action version where tying gun rotation and descent are executed concurrently. Experiments involving 32-node tying sequences across four stations demonstrate that the optimized algorithm reduces average operation time by over 50% while maintaining stable performance. The results validate the robustness, flexibility, and reusability of the proposed intermediary system, supporting autonomous task execution without code-level changes. This architecture offers a scalable solution for intelligent construction robotics.

title: High Frequency Transmitter System Parameter Design
authors: Yixin Liang, Yuhan Liu
publish: 2025 IEEE 3rd International Conference on Control, Electronics and Computer Technology (ICCECT)
abstract: The frequency modulation transmitter system is designed in this paper. The system mainly includes carrier oscillator, frequency modulation circuit, frequency multiplier, mixer, power amplifier and other unit circuits. In this paper, the mixing and power amplification are mainly studied. The mixing unit part is designed by comparing different mixers, and finally adopts the circuit combining the transistor mixer and the multiplier mixer. After experimental simulation, the rationality of parameter design is verified, and it can meet the needs of the overall design of the transmitter. MC145166P chip is used to design the unit circuit of high frequency power amplifier, and Class C power amplifier is selected. Different design schemes are compared, focusing on distortion, power gain, pass band width and other technical indicators. Through experimental simulation, the rationality and realizability of the design scheme are verified, and it can meet the needs of the whole system design of FM transmitter. At this point, the transmission frequency reaches the expected value, which is transmitted from the antenna and then received by the receiving.

title: A New Framework Integrating Machine Learning with an Enhanced Genghis Khan Shark Optimizer for Skin Cancer Diagnosis
authors: Leen Waleed Abu-Hamdeh, Hessa Al Dhanhani, Fatma Al Ketbi, Malak Bouali, Ahmed M. Khedr
publish: 2025 Eighth International Conference on Image Information Processing (ICIIP)
abstract: Skin cancer remains one of the most prevalent and life-threatening diseases worldwide, where early and accurate diagnosis is critical for effective treatment. This paper presents an autonomous computer-aided diagnosis (CAD) framework for skin cancer classification that integrates deep feature extraction and optimization-based feature selection. Deep features are extracted using the ResNet-18 architecture, while the Genghis Khan Shark Optimizer (GKSO) and its enhanced variant (EGKSO) are employed to perform efficient feature selection. The proposed EGKSO framework introduces adaptive prey dynamics, elite mutation, and reverse learning mechanisms to improve convergence and feature discrimination. Experimental results demonstrate that the EGKSO-SVM configuration achieves the highest classification accuracy of 96%, outperforming both the baseline ResNet-18 and GKSO-based models. The proposed system offers a robust and interpretable approach that can assist clinicians in reducing diagnostic errors and improving decision support in skin cancer screening.

title: Optimizing Visual Comfort: A Dialux-Based Redesign of Computer Laboratory Lighting
authors: Marvin A. Radaza, Joecyn N. Archival, Alaine Tess A. Cabije, Deolinda E. Caparroso, Marlito V. Patunob, Emelie C. Villaceran
publish: 2025 International Conference on Artificial Intelligence for Sustainable Innovation (AI-SI)
abstract: This study investigates the significant <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\mathbf{r}$</tex> ole that lighting design plays in enhancing visual comfort and efficiency in computer laboratories, utilizing Dialux software to simulate and optimize visual comfort levels. With lighting inadequacy often causing discomfort and lower productivity, this research aims to develop customized solutions aligned with the guidelines of illuminance levels ranging from 300 to 500 lux. Through a critical evaluation of the uniformity of lighting and the elimination of glare, the findings present the importance of adhering to lighting standards within learning spaces. The focus is on a user-driven approach, using feedback loops to more effectively harmonize lighting designs with user ergonomic standards and preferences. Additionally, the research examines smart lighting technology to enhance energy efficiency w hile e nriching t he l earning environment. By exploring issues such as glare management and uneven illumination, this study provides insights of particular value in addressing gaps within the existing literature on lighting design, thereby compelling subsequent research to build upon and transfer these findings across a range of learning spaces.

title: Research on the Design of Intelligent Nursery Management Robot Based on Deep Learning
authors: Jing Zhao, Lei Li
publish: 2025 IEEE 3rd International Conference on Control, Electronics and Computer Technology (ICCECT)
abstract: The research program is aimed at designing an automation-based intelligent nursery management robot that will show a great promise for applied research in agricultural robotics, especially the application of object detection algorithms. While working on object detection algorithms, a systematic comparison proposes the superiority of CNN-based algorithms as relatively better performing with great accuracy and real-time performance over traditional methods. In the core algorithm, the analysis of classic CNN s lays down a theoretical basis for the design and implementation of the robot vision system. Meticulous organization and fabrication of datasets served to ensure diversity and richness of the training data, providing incisive foundational support in the afterward control system development for the robotic arm. With the employment of effective means of communication and a rational hardware composition, the robotic arm exhibited excellent sequential control performance while the detailed tuning of servo parameters and program design allowed highly-targeted tasks to be integrated seamlessly. During a series of comprehensive testing, the experimental data on the robot was obtained with reliability through its impressively successful operation and stable performance, invigorating and opening up opportunities for an intelligent nursery management field that presents itself as a pivotal milestone in the trajectory towards agricultural production automation and intelligence.

title: Exploring Performance Variability in Deep Neural Networks for Motor Imagery Classification: Towards a Zero-Calibration Brain-Computer Interface
authors: Pasquale Arpaia, Antonio Esposito, Enza Galasso, Fortuna Galdieri, Angela Natalizio, Marco Parvis, Andrea Pollastro
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Metrology for eXtended Reality, Artificial Intelligence and Neural Engineering (MetroXRAINE)
abstract: This study focuses on leveraging deep learning and transfer learning techniques for classifying EEG signals recorded during motor imagery tasks. The primary objective is to develop a robust brain-computer interface (BCI) system capable of operating effectively in a zero-calibration scenario. Deep neural networks are investigated to improve classification accuracy. However, performance variability due to uncertainty sources is a critical challenge. To assess this variability, the effects of parameter initialization and pre-processing were analyzed. EEGNet and Sinc-EEGNet served as test models. Results indicate that network's weight initialization significantly impacts performance. Classification accuracy actually improves from 67 % ± 3 % to 73 % ± 3 % with adjusted initialization. Conversely, EEG pre-processing does not improve performance. As a result, pre-processing can be omitted to reduce computational effort. These findings support the development of real-time application scenarios.

title: Fractal-Shaped Transmission-Based Microwave Sensor with Machine Learning Support for Glucose Detection: Model Investigation
authors: Sandra Costanzo, Antonio Curcio, Giovanni Buonanno
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Metrology for eXtended Reality, Artificial Intelligence and Neural Engineering (MetroXRAINE)
abstract: A fractal-shaped configuration of microwave sensor working in the transmission mode is considered in this work to be adopted in the framework of non-invasive blood glucose monitoring. Machine-learning support is integrated as well to implement a highly accurate procedure for the identification of glucose concentration, by proposing energy content features equivalently related to standard statistical descriptors and being able to realize both regression and classification models with high reconstruction accuracy.

title: Conceptual Design of a Personalized VR Furniture Arrangement System
authors: Nan Huang, Prashant Goswami, Yan Hu, Veronica Sundstedt, Abbas Cheddad, Muhammad Imran
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Metrology for eXtended Reality, Artificial Intelligence and Neural Engineering (MetroXRAINE)
abstract: This paper presents a conceptual design for a virtual reality (VR)-based furniture arrangement system, proposed to leverage immersive technologies and generative AI (GenAI) with intuitive interaction methods. The system utilizes a head-mounted display (HMD) to provide an immersive and intuitive user experience (UX) with multimodal interaction methods through hand and eye-tracking controls. Additionally, GenAl enables the virtual agent to engage in natural conversations with users and interpret and respond contextually, aiming to enhance personalization by understanding conversations. Users' interests and preferences are analyzed and predicted from the conversation and eye-gaze data, which provides recommendations for relevant furniture items and real-time personalized feedback. By combining these techniques, this design aims to create a seamless, interactive, intelligent, personalized virtual interior design and furniture arrangement experience within the immersive virtual environment (VE). The implementation of several key features demonstrates a proof of concept for our virtual furniture arrangement system.

title: Research on 3D Model Database Transmission Efficiency Optimization System Based on Artificial Intelligence
authors: Zhihua Xu
publish: 2025 IEEE 3rd International Conference on Control, Electronics and Computer Technology (ICCECT)
abstract: This paper proposes a 3D model database transmission efficiency optimization system based on artificial intelligence, aiming to solve the problem of bandwidth and storage resource waste in high-dimensional data transmission. The system combines adaptive quantization and encoding algorithms to effectively compress and encode 3D model data, reduce data redundancy and improve transmission efficiency. This system extracts and compresses the features of 3D models based on deep learning algorithms, and uses adaptive quantization technology to dynamically adjust the data volume according to the complexity of the model to ensure that the compression rate is maximized while maintaining visual quality. To verify the performance of the algorithm, this paper designs a series of simulation experiments and compares multiple optimization schemes. During the simulation process, multiple data sets are used to test indicators such as transmission time, bandwidth occupancy and compression rate. The experimental results show that compared with traditional methods, the transmission efficiency of this system is improved by more than 30%, while the bandwidth occupancy is reduced by about 25%, and the information loss during transmission is controllable.

title: Towards Robust Detection for Malicious Injection Variants
authors: Yanjing Yang, Bohan Liu, He Zhang, Jinwei Xu, Xin Zhou, Jun Lyu, Zhewen Mao, Dongxue Pan
publish: IEEE Transactions on Software Engineering
abstract: Web applications deployed in cloud platforms expose APIs that are vulnerable to injection attacks. Cloud platform providers need to establish Web Application Firewalls (WAFs) at application API gateways to mitigate these risks. However, WAFs often struggle to intercept Malicious Injection Variants (MIVs) generated through mutations that differ from historical attack patterns. Adversarial training, which involves generating MIVs using techniques similar to those used by attackers and then refining detection models in WAFs with these MIVs, is a promising means of enhancing detection capabilities. Driven by this challenge, we propose AdaRode, which is an adversarially augmented robust detector training method designed from the perspective of defenders. To ensure the diversity of the generated MIVs, we comprehensively collected mutation meta-rule for SQL and XSS injections. To improve the efficiency of generating MIVs, we propose a sampling algorithm that uses internal model outputs as feedback for validating generated variants. Additionally, we conducted experiments to select the suitable model backbone. The evaluation results demonstrate that the detector generated by AdaRode significantly outperforms existing baseline methods in detecting both original attacks and attacks using MIVs. Our method improves the detection of MIVs by 10% of F<sub xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">1</sub> compared with baseline detectors. For generating MIVs, the adversarial algorithm within our method significantly outperforms the existing algorithms regarding the comprehensive consideration of generation efficiency and diversity.

title: Beyond the Cloud: Edge AI Evolution, Trends, Challenges, and Future Prospects
authors: Mehardeep Kaur, Kiran Rani, Jagdeep Singh, Pankaj Bhambri
publish: 2025 Eighth International Conference on Image Information Processing (ICIIP)
abstract: Edge computing is revolutionizing the data processing paradigm by placing computation closer to the data source. This survey examines the combination of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and edge computing for increased efficiency, reduced latency, and better use of resources. We survey some recent progressions and discuss AI methods for adaptive workload allocation, energy usage, and intelligent decision-making at the edge of the network. We also discuss the potential of AI for predictive maintenance, traffic optimization, and anomaly detection in edge environments. By mediating deficits of cloud-based centralized technology, edge computing with AI as a technology is an essential paradigm to faster, smarter, and more robust data-driven services.

title: EEG Correlates of Car Sickness in Naturalistic Driving Conditions
authors: Lucas Benoit, Nicolas Farrugia, Eléonore Henry, Clément Bongard, Giulia Lioi
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Metrology for eXtended Reality, Artificial Intelligence and Neural Engineering (MetroXRAINE)
abstract: This study investigates EEG correlates of car sickness during real-world slalom driving. Seventeen participants were exposed to low-frequency lateral accelerations while EEG was recorded using dry electrodes. The signal was preprocessed with ICA-based artifact removal and segmented into task-specific epochs. Spectral relative power was extracted across four brain regions and frequency bands. Analysis were conducted within and between groups according to their sensitivity. Results revealed that participants sensitive to car sickness exhibited distinct spatial and spectral patterns, including higher Gamma activity in parietal regions and reduced Alpha power in occipital areas. These findings highlight EEG as a viable tool to characterize neural responses to car sickness in ecological conditions.

title: Design of Multi Functional Deicing Transformer Operation Monitoring System
authors: Yue Li, Hong Liang, Houhua Chen, Changqin Quan, Guiyu Wu
publish: 2025 IEEE 3rd International Conference on Control, Electronics and Computer Technology (ICCECT)
abstract: In certain regions, the distribution network lines are susceptible to icing during winter and spring. This situation can readily cause equipment damage or even power outages, thereby affecting the reliability of power supply in the regional distribution network. In most areas, traditional manual de-icing methods are employed, which incur high labor costs and exhibit low emergency response efficiency. Consequently, this paper presents a multifunctional defrosting transformer. During the defrosting period, defrosting operation can be achieved by adjusting the defrosting switch to generate short-circuit current. In the non-defrosting period, it can function as a general transformer to supply power to the distribution network. Additionally, the architecture and design scheme of the operation monitoring system for the multifunctional defrosting transformer are proposed, offering a strong technical reference for the actual distribution network to deal with icing disasters.

title: Securing LLM-Generated Embedded Firmware Through AI Agent-Driven Validation and Patching
authors: Seyed Moein Abtahi, Akramul Azim
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Collaborative Advances in Software and COmputiNg (CASCON)
abstract: Large Language Models (LLMs) show promise in generating firmware for embedded systems but often introduce security flaws and fail to meet real-time performance constraints. This paper proposes a three-phase methodology that combines LLM-based firmware generation with automated security validation and iterative refinement in a virtualized environment. Using structured prompts, models like GPT-4 generate firmware for networking and control tasks, deployed on FreeRTOS via QEMU. These implementations are tested using fuzzing, static analysis, and runtime monitoring to detect vulnerabilities such as buffer overflows (CWE-120), race conditions (CWE-362), and denial-of-service threats (CWE-400). Specialized AI agents for Threat Detection, Performance Optimization, and Compliance Verification collaborate to improve detection and remediation. Identified issues are categorized using CWE, then used to prompt targeted LLM-generated patches in an iterative loop. Experiments show a 92.4% Vulnerability Remediation Rate (37.3% improvement), <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\text{95.8 \%}$</tex> Threat Model Compliance, and 0.87 Security Coverage Index. Real-time metrics include 8.6 ms worst-case execution time and <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$195 \mu$</tex> jitter. This process enhances firmware security and performance while contributing an open-source dataset for future research.

title: Detecting Stress in the Digital Age: Leveraging Deep Learning and Attention Mechanisms on Reddit Posts
authors: Priti Shree, Ajay Shankar Tiwari, Prashant
publish: 2025 International Conference on Responsible, Generative and Explainable AI (ResGenXAI)
abstract: Mental health challenges are being acknowledged as significant global issues.Prompt identification of stress symptoms can significantly facilitate prompt response.Reddit, as a prevalent social site, encompasses extensive textual data that mirrors users' emotional conditions.Using such data to automatically identify stress offers a chance to use machine learning methods for practical mental health assistance. The goal of this project is to create a deep learning-based method for determining whether Reddit articles are stressful or not.To attain excellent prediction performance, the process entails building different LSTM-based models, improving them through attention mechanisms, and refining them with GloVe embeddings and hyperparameter adjustment. With class-wise F1-scores of 0.73 for non-stress and 0.77 for stress, the experimental results show that the LSTM model with attention had the highest test accuracy of 75.%. These results point to the potential for scalable mental health screening systems by demonstrating that deep learning approaches can successfully extract stress indicators from textual data.

title: Explainable Ensemble Learning for Multi-Nutrient Soil Modeling with Multilingual Decision Support
authors: A M Nandhana, Muthu Palaniappan M
publish: 2025 International Conference on Responsible, Generative and Explainable AI (ResGenXAI)
abstract: Accurate prediction of soil nutrient levels is vital for precision agriculture, yet current models often lack scalability, interpretability, and accessibility for end-users, especially in multilingual settings. We propose an explainable ensemble learning framework for multi-nutrient soil modeling, integrating both macronutrients (N, P, K) and micronutrients (Zn, Fe, Mn, Cu, S, B). The system employs a heterogeneous ensemble of tree-based regressors and multi-target learners, optimized for predictive performance and interpretability. Model explainability is achieved using SHAP, ensuring transparent nutrient-specific insights across agronomic data manifolds. To enhance responsible deployment, we incorporate a generative multilingual interpretation module that translates model outputs into human-aligned, region-specific textual recommendations in multiple Indian languages. This supports actionable decision-making by farmers and field officers, even in low-resource linguistic contexts. The framework is trained and validated on a large scale, geo diverse soil dataset from India, achieving notable improvements in RMSE and <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\mathrm{R}^{{2}}$</tex> metrics over baseline models, while maintaining fairness across underrepresented soil types through stratified sampling. This work demonstrates how responsible ensemble learning, combined with generative multilingual explanations, can bridge the last mile gap in AI-powered agronomic support systems. The approach aligns with the principles of explainable and inclusive AI for sustainable agriculture.
